Which of the following is a definition of glycemic index?

options.label: A
options.text: The increase in the blood concentration of glucose after consuming the food.

options.label: B
options.text: The increase in the blood concentration of glucose after consuming the food compared with an equivalent amount of white bread.

options.label: C
options.text: The increase in the blood concentration of insulin after consuming the food

options.label: D
options.text: The increase in the blood concentration of insulin after consuming the food compared with an equivalent amount of white bread.

questions.correct_answer: A. The increase in the blood concentration of glucose after consuming the food.

questions.text: Select the one of the following statements that is NOT CORRECT:

options.label: A
options.text: Wilson disease can be treated using copper chelators such as penicillamine.

options.label: B
options.text: Wilson disease is characterized by copper toxicosis (abnormally high levels of copper).

options.label: C
options.text: Wilson disease is caused by mutation in the gene encoding ceruloplasmin.

questions.correct_answer: C. Wilson disease is caused by mutation in the gene encoding ceruloplasmin.

questions.text: Select one of the following statements that is NOT CORRECT:

options.label: B
options.text: Albumin bound bilirubin is transported to the liver.

options.label: C
options.text: High levels of bilirubin can cause damage to the brains of newborn infants

options.label: D
options.text: Bilirubin contains methyl and vinyl groups

questions.correct_answer: A. Bilirubin is a cyclic tetrapyrrole.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about purine nucleotide metabolism is NOT CORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: An early step in purine biosynthesis is the formation of PRPP (phosphoribosyl 1-pyrophosphate).

options.label: B
options.text: Orotic acid is an intermediate in pyrimidine nucleotide biosynthesis

options.label: C
options.text: Humans catabolize uridine and pseudo-uridine by analogous reactions.

options.label: D
options.text: Ribonucleotide reductase converts nucleoside diphosphates to the corresponding deoxyribo nucleoside diphosphates.

questions.correct_answer: C. Humans catabolize uridine and pseudo-uridine by analogous reactions.

questions.text: With regard to eukaryotic mRNAs, one of the following is not the property of mRNAs.

options.label: A
options.text: Eukaryotic mRNAs have special modifications at heir 5? (cap) and 3?(poly(A) tail) termini.

options.label: B
options.text: Are attached to ribosomes when they are translated.

options.label: C
options.text: They are found in the cytoplasm within peroxisomes.

options.label: D
options.text: Most have significant noncoding segment that does not direct assembly of amino acids.

questions.correct_answer: C. They are found in the cytoplasm within peroxisomes.

questions.text: The initiator tRNA is placed within the active 80S complex at which of the three canonical ribosomal “sites” dueing protein synthesis
True statement regarding chaperone proteins is the following:

options.label: A
options.text: True statement regarding chaperone proteins is the following:

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Present in prokaryotes as well as eukaryotes
  • • • Induced by heat, stress or acidosis
  • • • Bind to hydrophobic regions of unfolded and aggregated proteins and act as a quality control or editing mechanism for detecting misfolded proteins
  • • • Most show ATPase activity
  • • • Found in cytosol, mitochondria and endoplasmic reticulum lumen
  • • • Examples include Heat shock proteins, Calnexin, calreticulin, BiP, GRP94, PDI, PPI etc

questions.text: One of the first chemotherapeutic agents was methotrexate , a compound that was effective in killing rapidly dividing cells like those of leukemias. This compound would be expected to elevate concentrations of Which of the following compounds?

A 2-year old child is hospitalized for evaluation of poor growth and low muscle tone. The most striking physical findings is unruly, “Kinky’’ hair but the child also has increased joint laxity and thin skin. Which of following lab findings is most likely?

options.label: A
options.text: Contain a TATA box downstream from the start site of transcription

options.label: B
options.text: May contain a CAAT box in the 5' flanking region

options.label: C
options.text: Are transcribed by RNA polymerase III

options.label: D
options.text: Contain long stretches of thymine nucleotides that produce the poly(A) tail of mRNA

questions.correct_answer: B. May contain a CAAT box in the 5' flanking region

questions.text: Which one of the following statements is true regarding iron metabolism?

options.label: A
options.text: Plasma iron levels follow a circadian rhythm

options.label: B
options.text: Iron can only cross cell membranes in the ferric form

options.label: C
options.text: Only 30% of dietary iron is absorbed in the upper small intestine

options.label: D
options.text: Reduction in gastric acid levels results in increased absorption of iron

questions.correct_answer: A. Plasma iron levels follow a circadian rhythm
